result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah L. Champion

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:52 PM Defendant Sarah L. Champion appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Court does not hear bond motion, must file proper paperwork. Matter continued to allow defendant time to submit petition for court appointed attorney and sign bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waiver of no contact provision of bond - CM

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:00 PM   Defendant Sarah L. Champion appeared by video.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Sarah L. Champion.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond of $1000 set.  No contact with C.M.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim, CM his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.
